results.title: Immortal image
results.brief_description: Examines the sculpture of Ukrainian-born artist Leo Mol and follows his technique, the lost wax method, as he creates a portrait in bronze. Includes comments by the artist.

results.title: Imagination 10
results.creator_credit: Morton Goldscholl, Champion Papers and Morton Goldscholl Design
results.brief_description: This film pays tribute to the railroad and its contribution to America; discusses the type of life and work of the people who run the passenger and freight trains. Shows the aesthetic appeal of steel and steam and the beauty of nature along the right of way and is almost an abstract painting seen from a parlour car window, a montage of people. The film was prepared in conjunction with the publishing of a monograph on a variety of papers used by the railroads.

results.title: Il Est Minuit, Docteur Schweitzer
results.brief_description:
This biopic of Albert Schweitzer follows the young graduate of Medical school all the way to Gabon where he sets up a dispensary with the help of nurse Marie Winter. Their effort are interrupted with the onset of World War I as Albert realises he is a German citizen established in a French colony. See also: ‘Le Grand Blanc de Lambarene’(NLA #2108812, VHS).

Credits: Producer, Georges Bernier ; director, Andre Haguet ; writers, Andre Haguet, Henri-Andre Legrand ; photography, Lucien Joulin ; music, Maurice-Paul Guillot.
Cast: Pierre Fresnay, Jeanne Moreau, Raymond Rouleau, Jany Vallieres, Jean Debucourt.

results.title: Ikebana: Japanese art of flower arrangement
results.brief_description: Ikebana is the Japanese art of flower arrangement which is now known throughout the Western world. The history, principles and theory of this type of flower arrangement are told.

results.title: If you know how I feel: Scott's old new friend
results.creator_credit: Linda Haskins and Centron Educational Films
results.brief_description: Tells the story of 10-year-old Scott who befriends an old woman in a park. The value of their friendship is revealed as Scott obtains books for the woman and she helps him to improve his reading. A sympathetic portrayal of old age that will help in breaking down stereotypes and promoting discussion about values and self-determination. Suitable for middle and upper primary levels.

results.title: If war should come
results.brief_description: Part of the “History through the newsreel: the 1930s” series which presents extracts from newreels which were shown to the British public during the years 1937 to 1939. Covers Britain’s rearmament plans (1937); Guernica’s collapse in air raids during the Spanish Civil War; Tsingtao falling to the Japanese; the opening of a British Military Base in Singapore; the building of the French Maginot Line; the development of bomb proof shelter; air raid precaution techniques in Australia and England; the development of the Spitfire; the introduction of conscription in April 1939; a civil defence recruiting trailer; and the evacuation of children from Britain’s large cities. Suitable for middle and upper secondary levels.

results.brief_description: Panel members Charles Brown, Amy Hostler, Leonard W. Mayo, and John Rose discuss situations demonstrated in Part 1, talking about the children’s behaviour while flashbacks bring significant scenes into focus.
